etymology.description: Depicts a forked tongue emerging upwards from a mouth
etymology.interpretation: The character 舌(shé, 'tongue') visually represents a tongue extending out from a mouth, which aligns with its meaning. This direct depiction makes it easy to remember its association with speech and taste in its semantic family, also relating to words like 言(yán, 'word').

examples.chinese: 他的舌非常灵敏(他的舌非常靈敏)。
品尝美食时(品嚐美食時)，他的舌细品滋味(他的舌細品滋味)。
examples.pinyin: Pǐncháng měishí shí, tā de shé xì pǐn zīwèi.
examples.english: While tasting delicious food, his tongue savors every flavor.

examples.chinese: 他长舌无忌(他長舌無忌)，经常泄露秘密(經常泄露秘密)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chángshé wújì, jīngcháng xièlòu mìmì.
examples.english: He is talkative and often spills secrets.
